00020 /**
00021  * The Push Notification Custom Message.
00022  *
00023  * The class represents a custom message to be delivered to an end user device.
00024  * Please refer to Table 3-2 for more information.
00025  *
00026  * @ingroup ApnsPHP_Message
00027  * @see http://tinyurl.com/ApplePushNotificationPayload
00028  */
00029 class ApnsPHP_Message_Custom extends ApnsPHP_Message
00030 {
00031     protected $_sActionLocKey; /**< @type string The "View" button title. */
00032     protected $_sLocKey; /**< @type string A key to an alert-message string in a Localizable.strings file */
00033     protected $_aLocArgs; /**< @type array Variable string values to appear in place of the format specifiers in loc-key. */
00034     protected $_sLaunchImage; /**< @type string The filename of an image file in the application bundle. */
00035 
00036     /**
00037      * Set the "View" button title.
00038      *
00039      * If a string is specified, displays an alert with two buttons.
00040      * iOS uses the string as a key to get a localized string in the current localization
00041      * to use for the right button’s title instead of "View". If the value is an
00042      * empty string, the system displays an alert with a single OK button that simply
00043      * dismisses the alert when tapped.
00044      *
00045      * @param  $sActionLocKey @type string @optional The "View" button title, default
00046      *         empty string.
00047      */
00048     public function setActionLocKey($sActionLocKey = '')
00049     {
00050         $this->_sActionLocKey = $sActionLocKey;
00051     }
00052 
00053     /**
00054      * Get the "View" button title.
00055      *
00056      * @return @type string The "View" button title.
00057      */
00058     public function getActionLocKey()
00059     {
00060         return $this->_sActionLocKey;
00061     }
00062 
00063     /**
00064      * Set the alert-message string in Localizable.strings file for the current
00065      * localization (which is set by the user’s language preference).
00066      *
00067      * The key string can be formatted with %@ and %n$@ specifiers to take the variables
00068      * specified in loc-args.
00069      *
00070      * @param  $sLocKey @type string The alert-message string.
00071      */
00072     public function setLocKey($sLocKey)
00073     {
00074         $this->_sLocKey = $sLocKey;
00075     }
00076 
00077     /**
00078      * Get the alert-message string in Localizable.strings file.
00079      *
00080      * @return @type string The alert-message string.
00081      */
00082     public function getLocKey()
00083     {
00084         return $this->_sLocKey;
00085     }
00086 
00087     /**
00088      * Set the variable string values to appear in place of the format specifiers
00089      * in loc-key.
00090      *
00091      * @param  $aLocArgs @type array The variable string values.
00092      */
00093     public function setLocArgs($aLocArgs)
00094     {
00095         $this->_aLocArgs = $aLocArgs;
00096     }
00097 
00098     /**
00099      * Get the variable string values to appear in place of the format specifiers
00100      * in loc-key.
00101      *
00102      * @return @type string The variable string values.
00103      */
00104     public function getLocArgs()
00105     {
00106         return $this->_aLocArgs;
00107     }
00108 
00109     /**
00110      * Set the filename of an image file in the application bundle; it may include
00111      * the extension or omit it.
00112      *
00113      * The image is used as the launch image when users tap the action button or
00114      * move the action slider. If this property is not specified, the system either
00115      * uses the previous snapshot, uses the image identified by the UILaunchImageFile
00116      * key in the application’s Info.plist file, or falls back to Default.png.
00117      * This property was added in iOS 4.0.
00118      *
00119      * @param  $sLaunchImage @type string The filename of an image file.
00120      */
00121     public function setLaunchImage($sLaunchImage)
00122     {
00123         $this->_sLaunchImage = $sLaunchImage;
00124     }
00125 
00126     /**
00127      * Get the filename of an image file in the application bundle.
00128      *
00129      * @return @type string The filename of an image file.
00130      */
00131     public function getLaunchImage()
00132     {
00133         return $this->_sLaunchImage;
00134     }
00135 
00136     /**
00137      * Get the payload dictionary.
00138      *
00139      * @return @type array The payload dictionary.
00140      */
00141     protected function _getPayload()
00142     {
00143         $aPayload = parent::_getPayload();
00144 
00145         $aPayload['aps']['alert'] = array();
00146 
00147         if (isset($this->_sText) && !isset($this->_sLocKey)) {
00148             $aPayload['aps']['alert']['body'] = (string)$this->_sText;
00149         }
00150 
00151         if (isset($this->_sActionLocKey)) {
00152             $aPayload['aps']['alert']['action-loc-key'] = $this->_sActionLocKey == '' ?
00153                 null : (string)$this->_sActionLocKey;
00154         }
00155 
00156         if (isset($this->_sLocKey)) {
00157             $aPayload['aps']['alert']['loc-key'] = (string)$this->_sLocKey;
00158         }
00159 
00160         if (isset($this->_aLocArgs)) {
00161             $aPayload['aps']['alert']['loc-args'] = $this->_aLocArgs;
00162         }
00163 
00164         if (isset($this->_sLaunchImage)) {
00165             $aPayload['aps']['alert']['launch-image'] = (string)$this->_sLaunchImage;
00166         }
00167 
00168         return $aPayload;
00169     }
00170 }
